title: Create CLI skeleton and register with main app

task.title: Create CLI skeleton and register with main app
task.description:
## Context
Create the Typer CLI commands for Toolsmith and wire them into the main Cub CLI. Commands will be stubs initially, wired to real implementation in Phase 3.

## Implementation Hints

**Recommended Model:** haiku
**Estimated Duration:** 1h
**Approach:** Follow existing Cub CLI patterns from `cub/cli/`. Create a Typer sub-app and register it in `cub/cli/__init__.py`.

## Implementation Steps
1. Create `src/cub/cli/toolsmith.py`
2. Create Typer app: `app = typer.Typer(name="toolsmith", help="Discover and catalog tools")`
3. Add `sync` command stub with `--source` option
4. Add `search` command stub with query argument and `--live`, `--source` options
5. Add `stats` command stub
6. Register in `src/cub/cli/__init__.py` under appropriate help panel
7. Verify `cub toolsmith --help` works

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `cub toolsmith --help` shows available commands
- [ ] `cub toolsmith sync --help` shows sync options
- [ ] `cub toolsmith search --help` shows search options
- [ ] `cub toolsmith stats --help` shows stats description
- [ ] Commands print "Not implemented yet" placeholder
- [ ] Registered under "Manage Your Roadmap" or new panel in CLI
- [ ] mypy passes with strict mode

## Files Likely Involved
- `src/cub/cli/toolsmith.py` (new)
- `src/cub/cli/__init__.py` (modify to register)

## Notes
- Use `Annotated[str, typer.Argument()]` for modern Typer syntax
- Add `rich_help_panel` for proper grouping
- Stub implementations should use `console.print("[yellow]Not implemented yet[/yellow]")`
